pr_title: FM2-251: Add support for overriding default narratives

timeline.message: FM2-251: Add support for overriding default narratives

timeline.bodyText: It now adds the file: prefix if there is no prefix in the path, since the loadResource() method requires either classpath: or file: prefix.
timeline.author: ShivanshRakesh

replies.bodyText:
Two points on this:

Could you add what you said above as a comment on this line of code.
Isn't path = "file:" + path easier to read?
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
Could you add what you said above as a comment on this line of code.


Okay.


Isn't path = "file:" + path easier to read?


Yeah, I'll change it to this.
replies.author: ShivanshRakesh

timeline.bodyText: I've added few checks for the properties file.
timeline.author: ShivanshRakesh

timeline.bodyText: I've restructured this the way suggested here.
timeline.author: ShivanshRakesh

+package org.openmrs.module.fhir2.web.util;
+
+import static org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger;
+
+import javax.validation.constraints.NotNull;
+
+import org.slf4j.Logger;
+
+public class NarrativeUtils {
+	
+	private static final Logger LOGGER = getLogger(NarrativeUtils.class);

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's not a constant so I guess using logger is better. I'll use logger instead.
replies.author: ShivanshRakesh

replies.bodyText: @HerbertYiga should I use log instead? I just saw that log has been used at other places in the repository.
replies.author: ShivanshRakesh

replies.bodyText: Actually, if I can suggest, just annotate the class with the @Slf4j annotation, which will magically generate the log variable for you. See here.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Oh that's nice! Will do that.
replies.author: ShivanshRakesh

timeline.bodyText: hI @ibacher   How does this entire pr look to you?
